alert.note: Alert for Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 22 at 12:40AM CDT until September 22 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Adams and Webster. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas, such as in Hastings, is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1238 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in portions of Hastings. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. However, rainfall rates will be much lower than earlier tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hastings, Red Cloud, Blue Hill, Kenesaw, Juniata, Bladen, Roseland, Holstein, Ayr, Cowles and Inavale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
